alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Howell; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 13 at 8:43PM CDT until May 14 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Howell County in south central Missouri... Southwestern Texas County in south central Missouri... Eastern Douglas County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 245 AM CDT Sunday. * At 843 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mountain Grove, Willow Springs, Cabool, Pomona, Vanzant, Drury, Siloam Springs, Gentryville, Brushyknob and Bryant Creek State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
